intro: Machaerium mucronatum, commonly known as the narrow-pointed machaerium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or bean family, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to greenish in color, and it produces pods that contain several seeds. Machaerium mucronatum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
